result.execSummary:
The defendant Abundio S. SOLANO was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Oxycodone), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence defendant is presently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abundio S. SOLANO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change from DOC indicating defendant's mandatory release revoked - sentenced to prisonl effective 05-10-2016
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Defendant in custody.  
State moves to delete the enhancer, second and subsequent offense.  Motion granted.   
Possess Oxycodone - No contest plea.   Convicted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for four (4) months, under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence defendant is presently serving.   Court costs are waived. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.
Minutes.

Copy filed.

Plea hearing is set for 08-26-2014 @ 10:30 a.m. BR-2.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-01-14 at 1:30 p.m.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a preliminary hearing, on May 28, 2014, at 1:30 pm, from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution. 
Copy filed.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-28-14 at 1:30 p.m.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 05-12-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Copy filed.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 05-12-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours of release.  Defendant refused to sign.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 04-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Copy filed.

RE:  Possess Oxycodone-2nd offense, on 01-22-14.
Initial appearance is set for 04-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.
